cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 130 miles south of Charleston, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking north-northeast along the Southeast U.S. coast, then accelerating northeastward off the Mid-Atlantic and passing well southeast of New England toward Nova Scotia/Newfoundland.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the South Carolina–North Carolina coast (around Cape Fear, NC)

weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning: Savannah River GA to NC/VA border including Pamlico & Albemarle Sounds; Tropical-Storm Warning: Flagler/Volusia FL to Savannah River & NC/VA border to Chincoteague VA; Storm-Surge Warning: Flagler/Volusia FL to Poquoson VA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast U.S. coast from Florida to North Carolina, portions of the Mid-Atlantic, and later Atlantic Canada
weather_observation.wind: Gusty winds possible late Saturday with occasional gusts 25–35 mph; gale-force (≥34 kt) probability only 8%.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at Boston; surge focus remains south of New England.
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to moderate rainfall (around 1–2 inches) possible as the system passes southeast of the area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along the Massachusetts coastline beginning late Friday and persisting through Saturday.
